website_summaries.verdict: This sturdy bag is large enough to carry all your clubs and portable enough to go anywhere.
pros: Lockable zippers keep clubs from falling out
Internal and external compression straps to hold them in place
Spacious case that can accommodate your entire golf bag with room for extras
cons: There are a few complaints of the wheels breaking

customer_reviews.title: Didn't survive one plane ride!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Plastic on the bottom near the wheel cracked after only one trip on the plane. Unusable now! So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Clubs well protected!
customer_reviews.text: We travel a lot for vacation and my husband likes to take his golf clubs. This caddy fit perfectly over his carrying case and kept his clubs in pristine condition Previously had a carrier that got torn during transit. The clubs were okay but he was concerned the test would get bigger and something would fall out. This case seems to be much more sturdy than the previous one. Highly recommend this product for any golfer who flies. You don't still has plenty of room for your shoes and even a couple of pairs of pants, shorts, shoes and essentials so for a short trip you don't need another suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Kspunky

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly constructed. We just used it last weekend when we went away on a trip. Noticed upon reaching our destination that it is already starting to tear. One use and I am already looking for another one because I don't think it will make it through the second trip!
customer_reviews.author: Aliyah

customer_reviews.title: Great company, stand by their products
customer_reviews.text: Took this brand new bag on a direct flight from NY to PHX with a backbone stick in it to prevent club compression. Got to Phoenix with a snapped driver, mangled carrying bag, and destroyed golf bag. The whole bag looked like it got sucked into the conveyer system. Contacted the company directly and they offered me an even swap on a new hard case bag. The company itself is top notch and stand by their products, however I would not recommend a soft case travel bag especially after what I went through to get reimbursed for all the damages.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: USA to UK and perfect protection and quality!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to travel with an expensive set of ladies Calloway clubs, my shoes, clothes and plenty of golf balls. It stands up on its own, wheels easily and is surprisingly light when it has much padding and protection built in. Very pleased with this purchase as all of the features I chose this for worked very well. Strapping inside held the clubs in place and the overall quality of materials, zippers and tags included is excellent. Excellent value for money!
customer_reviews.author: H.ROBS.79

customer_reviews.title: Great bag and great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought and used on a recent trip to Kauai. This is a roomy and sturdy bag, not only did it hold all my golf clubs but I also put all my clothing and extra shoes in there (worked well as extra padding) and all held nicely. Easy to pull and the wheels rolled nicely. Definitely recommended especially if you love your golf clubs and want them to be protected.
customer_reviews.author: Terrie

customer_reviews.title: Travelled from US to Ireland
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted to take his clubs with him on our trip to Ireland. He bought this case along with the suggested pole to protect the clubs. We flew from LAX to YYZ to DUB. The clubs and bag were safe and sound. Everything was in proper condition, just how we left it. The pockets on the side are great for storing any extra luggage too! I mean the golf bag is already considered oversize so you might as well fill it to the brim with whatever you can. (ie shoes)
customer_reviews.author: Maddie Dame

customer_reviews.title: ... this once to protect my clubs and it did great. Flew from the west coast to the east ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this once to protect my clubs and it did great. Flew from the west coast to the east coast and back.This club caddy is very sturdy.There is plenty of room for my bag and a complete set of clubs with the head covers on for your woods and my shoes,The inner straps hold the bag in place then after its closed the outer straps will chinch it even more. Good soild zippers and heavy material.I don`t fly very often but when I road trip with buddies I still use the club caddy because if we are driving a pick-up the clubs go in the bed with three more bags so my clubs are well protected.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Seems good so far, Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: The travel cover seems very well made, plenty of room and storage pockets, though it has not been tested with travel as yet. I'll update after my trip. Update: The travel cover worked great, lots of room, could've put more into it than the 50 lb. weight limit allowed. No signs of wear or any loss of quality. Very happy, having my own clubs for 2 rounds of golf and a lesson at the Leadbetter Academy was well worth the cost of this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great Golf Travel Bag
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from our first trip with this travel golf bag. The whole golf bag fits inside this bag, plus there was room for my husband's golf shoes, golf balls, etc. There are two straps inside this bag to secure your golf bag, then it zips up so you can put a lock on it. There are also straps on the outside of the bag. Flew from the East Coast to the West and back, and this bag came through with flying colors. Very sturdy and a great price from Amazon. Recommend it very highly.
customer_reviews.author: mbrkelley

customer_reviews.title: Did the Job
customer_reviews.text: Travel cover worked great on my last trip. It's sturdy and large enough for my walker bag and clubs. Enough pockets for shoes and balls. The top needs something so that the driver club head doesn't get damaged so I put bubble wrap in between the club head and the top of the cover. Don't know if that unit you can purchase with the bag works but I probably should have ordered it. For the money it's great and did the job. Would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Spacious and padded, but it may put too much pressure on longer clubs.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Fit my entire bag, shoes, and had plenty of extra room for any miscellaneous items to fit inside. -The side pockets are a plus. -The bag stands up on its own which is very helpful when traveling with other bags. (Potential) Cons: Though the inside is padded, I do question if the bag puts too much pressure on the longer clubs (driver, woods, etc.) Therefore, I put an extendable telescope pole inside to prop it up and take pressure off the clubs.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Fichter

customer_reviews.title: Huge Regret
customer_reviews.text: Heartbroken - don't buy unless you enjoy opening your golf bag on vacation and finding your Callaway fairway wood literally broken in two pieces. Stick to a hard sided case! In addition, because it is black and rides so low to the ground when you're pulling it, it's a real tripping hazard for others in a busy airport. Thought it looked good and would store better-huge regrets. No Mulligan on this one. I'm past the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have used this guy for numerous trips and not a scratch
customer_reviews.text: My golf clubs are my absolute treasure, so it's not lightly that I say that this bag is fantastic at protecting my most valuable possession. There's extra space inside so i make sure to add even additional wrapping and protection to the clubheads, and I've yet to have any damage. The bag holds up to a good amount of abuse, and the outside pockets make it even easier to pack those extra balls and days of clothes in.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalBuyer154

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, durable, and functional bag.
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for a trip to Memphis TPC Southwind. I like this bag a lot. Very durable and I managed to stand it up without it falling over. Several straps outside of bag and one inside, all help stabalize your bag well. The outside handles are helpful too. Lots of room in this bag. Happy I bought it! Should last many trips. Wouldn't recommend it for someone who constantly travels with their clubs, but for someone like me who travels 3-5 times a year with clubs this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: DN Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good durable case
customer_reviews.text: The case was very spacious, I had enough room for my clubs shoes, and a few extra items as well. Only concern is I don’t know the longevity of the case. It made it to Hawaii and back in good shape so I trust it will do the job. There is extra padding on the top to help protect club heads. I did not use a stiff arm and it was fine. The best advice I’d give is make sure you remove club heads (drivers, woods) if at all possible. The extra security is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Anderson

customer_reviews.title: CaddyDaddy Golf Constrictor 2 Travel Cover... great value!
customer_reviews.text: Used for my trip to Myrtle Beach and it seems to have held up just fine. No damage to my clubs or the bag itself. Good quality, durable. The wheels work very well and seem to be of good quality so they should last. Great value. Overall very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: briguy

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, easy to transport
customer_reviews.text: I've used it on one trip and it's the first time I've ever taken my clubs. Other than them getting left at the original airport and having to be flown on a few more flights to get to me, it held up well. Very easy to transport. Getting a standard set of clubs and bag into it is a little tight. But it fits snug and the straps can close it up nicely. I wrapped my towels around my irons so they wouldn't clash together. I can't speak to the longevity of the bag but so far so good. I will update after another trip.
customer_reviews.author: Optimus Clay

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for travel
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my brother as a Christmas gift so he could transport his clubs to Scotland for a week of golf. He was very pleased with the sturdiness of the bag and it held up well through the airport transfers that it made
customer_reviews.author: tsirois1973

customer_reviews.title: Great bag and for the money you cant lose.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bag on two trips so far one being across the country and the bag still looks new. It is holding up well and is Huge!. I can pack so much more in the bag than just my clubs and shoes. I honestly could pack everything for a week long trip and not be tight on space. Maybe if you had Rodney Dangerfield's golf bag from Caddyshack you would be tight on space but I bet it would still fit. Joking aside it has plenty of space but is not too big.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Product was great on it's first trip
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the travel cover for a golf trip to Myrtle Beach. Everything held up, with no rips or tears to the bag, and my clubs made it both ways with no damage. I am very happy with the sturdiness of the bag. I did follow another persons advice and just bought a 2" wooden dowel rod and cut it so it was an inch taller than my driver to protect it from snapping. I was very nervous about this, and will probably buy the actual bag pole for my next trip, but it worked in a pinch!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A Masek

customer_reviews.title: Updated Design Problem
customer_reviews.text: I just finished my third flight. Unfortunately I discovered a SERIOUS design flaw. The lower front edge has no skid protections. This causes any rub to cut through the cover. It can only be corrected in the design but it makes the bag unusable because the bottom will fall out. Too late to return so I will have to buy a different design.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great bag and even better customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bag is well constructed. Stays well balanced when pulling off of sidewalk curbs, etc. One of my wheels got busted. Don’t know how it happened but it wasn’t due to poor construction. Called customer service (Rod) and they immediately shipped replacement. Rod went above and beyond with customer service when he proactively asked when I was traveling with my clubs again. I was 4 days away from my next trip so they expedited shipping and I had new bag in 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Hamm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality & durability
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed- I use this bag to ship event materials around from event to event (8-10x/year). The bag will weigh on the upwards of 75 pounds sometimes and is still easy to get around and move. We ship it FedEx, unboxed and the wheels have held up, the handles are intact and the material is in good shape (I've had it since July 2018). I'm about to buy another one to use for our banners.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Berg

customer_reviews.title: Worked but clumsy to get clubs into
customer_reviews.text: It’s gone on one round trip plane. Clubs survived but I bought the stick support and wrapped towels around the clubs. Pretty hard to get the clubs bag in the travel case I really struggled but the pockets on this are good and it all came back in one piece so I’m happy
customer_reviews.author: A. K. Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for me
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once with Shipsticks back and forth from New York to Florida without a backbone sick. Clubs fit in with a std driver length with a bit of room to spare. Liked the straps inside to secure the cart bag. Ample room to also pack golf shoes. All clubs shipped and returned home with no damage.
customer_reviews.author: Upstate NY Guy

customer_reviews.title: Golf Bag Great for Camping Gear
customer_reviews.text: This bag works great for Golf Bags as I have used it multiple times for its purpose. However When taking a trip to Yellowstone to do some backpacking I got a sticker shock from the airlines for trying to check all my gear... I used this bag and crammed it full of my tent, sleeping bag, hiking gear and even my trusty pillow. Most airlines only charge you a standard check fee of $25 or $30 to check a golf bag regardless of weight. So this bag certainly came in handy and paid for its self from one great roundtrip to Yellowstone. Great work around for backpackers and outdoor enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: B.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great protection
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. Have been both domestic and international with them and they are holding up great! Construction and maneuverability awesome. Like that they fold up out of the way when not in use. There’s even extra room in the back to pack extra clothes and travel gear along with clubs. No where near 50 pounds when we’ve weighed them with 4 days of stuff packed with the clubs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent golf bag for air travel, just not "solid" construction.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well padded, room for packing lots of extra clothing and gear, too! Did not want a solid construction bag, so I opted for this. It served me well for a vacation golf trip.
customer_reviews.author: R Crosier

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Liked: there is so much room that I stuffed in clothes of all sorts...t shirts, underwear, socks, anything soft and that could provide extra cushioning. In fact, I almost didn't need a suitcase for our trip. I used my golf alignment sticks which protruded above my driver to give the top extra support and packed clothes on the top too. Everything arrived fine. Concern: The bottom of the case feels like cardboard and I don't know how long it will hold up. Extra: I have 3 two-piece fishing poles. They fit nicely in the golf bag along side my clubs and arrived unbroken. No need now to buy a fishing container to ship poles!
customer_reviews.author: Squid

customer_reviews.title: Room, padding and insured bag info
customer_reviews.text: I only used this case once on a direct flight. It fits a stand up bag, two pairs of shoes, many sleeves of golf balls and plenty more room. The padding and straps seem as adequate as there has been no damage to be seen. It appears that it will last several more flights. As a side note, SWA does not insure a golf bag if it is any kind of soft case. They say they only guarantee hard cases, so this may change ones decision on what type of bad to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product - travel at least 20 trips before TSA broke the zipper - sent a couple pictures and replacement shipped before next trip - new one has 15 trips and not showing any wear. Bag hold everything I need for a couple rounds a week - will hold even the larger bags.
customer_reviews.author: Kml

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I have only completed one trip with this, but it did great. Highly recommend a club glove to protect your woods, but otherwise it is very secure and well padded. Plenty of room for a couple of pairs of shoes and anything else you want to throw in. Cant beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Parker

customer_reviews.title: Good size bag, lots of room.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for the first time on a golf trip this past weekend. Clubs fit fine with no apparent pressure or restrictions on my driver (normal size but my old bag was tight). Two good size pockets on the front that held 2 pairs of shows easily plus some other items. I like the external straps for securing the bag. My only dig is that the bag will not stand on its own (I recognize that this is not an expected feature for this bag). Price very reasonable for the product. Will see how well it holds up down the road but so far very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Bif

customer_reviews.title: Flew round trip. so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Flew from Seattle to Baltimore and back. No damage to my clubs or the bag itself by TSA. I did use a backbone brace inside the bag. No rips or anything like that. So far so good
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN GARLAND

customer_reviews.title: Used for trade show booth to check on a plane
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for going to a trade show and checked the bag on a plane. This is a solid, durable bag...I give 5 stars...worked great.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Easy Travel for Clubs
customer_reviews.text: I went on a golf trip to the Southwest this past spring and took my clubs along in the CaddyDaddy. It worked perfectly, protecting my clubs and had enough room for shoes and some of my golf clothes as well. Love that it is well padded along with rollers for easy transport.
customer_reviews.author: nanjking

customer_reviews.title: Really Well Built
customer_reviews.text: This is the third carrier I've had now and my favorite by far. My last purchase ended up being very bulky, and in spite of its ample storage, was really hard to move around. The CaddyDaddy is really well formed so that the clubs are in there tight, but the bag moves well on the wheels. I really like this bag, it's been great for my ample travels and no issues with clubs bending or breaking. I did take the extra step of buying the stiff-arm protector, also offered on Amazon, to give that top, umbrella-like protection.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Time

customer_reviews.title: CaddyDaddy functions well and reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: I have only used my CaddyDaddy once, but I am very impressed with it. I added a BagBoy steel insert to protect the clubs heads. It experienced normal handling by the airlines and I did not detect any damage to the outside material and with the padding inside my clubs were well protected. I am pleased with my purchase and feel that for the price the CaddyDaddy was a worthwhile purchase. I would recommend the CaddyDaddy to anyone who will be needing a substantial travel cover. Slick
customer_reviews.author: Slick

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, oversized
customer_reviews.text: This bag has everything you need. Fits my clubs and much more. Utilize all the space for when you're traveling. Throw in your shoes, extra balls, towels, clothes, whatever. Study as well.
customer_reviews.author: John Kettering

customer_reviews.title: Thick padding, high quality materials, plenty of extra storage...!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, extra thick padding around club heads, heavy duty materials, good zippers & wheels, pockets are perfect, and straps cinch down very well. The pockets provide room to easily store a shoe bag/shoes and even some extra clothes and a jacket if needed. The padding around the club heads is thick and also firm enough to protect against rough handling. The two straps cinch down tightly to make the top of the bag rather rigid, even without a back bone. My trip from the east coast out to Pebble was a breeze for this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Jerz_Subbie

customer_reviews.title: great bag!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical on what to purchase however after much research I purchased this bag. I am amazed at how well built it is. very durable, sturdy and does a great job of protecting my clubs and is also easy to maneuver. I also ordered the bagboy backbone which made a huge difference in protecting the clubs and keeping the bag rigid. great bag and would recommend it to anyone who travels with their clubs.
customer_reviews.author: ghostrider

customer_reviews.title: Durability.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used once but it performed well. Triple outside thickness won over the baggage handlers this time.we will see as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Fit our oversized clubs and held everything golf related we needed to take
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm on our fourteen hour day of flights. Top brand clubs arrived unharmed and well protected. Definitely worth the purchase and the expense to take it as a carryon.
customer_reviews.author: michele

customer_reviews.title: Quality Bags
customer_reviews.text: First I bought one (1) caddy daddy golf constrictor 2 travel cover (black/grey) bag and it was delivered as expected by the seller. The bag looks very nice and made with quality material with a heavy weight zipper that could be transported with the airline and I assume that the size will be accepted by the airline. That said, I ordered two (2) more golf bags for my two sons who also play golf as part of their Christmas present. The price is also vey reasonable. Thanks amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Agila

customer_reviews.title: Good price and build strong!!
customer_reviews.text: The shell is very roomy so my Sun Mountain loaded bag slips in no problem. There's 2 big pockets outside so very convenient to more stuff to store it. Wheels make easy to move and stand it's self
customer_reviews.author: Flyer210

customer_reviews.title: good bag for travel
customer_reviews.text: This is a good travel bag that fit our golf bags with room to spare. We didn't use it on a recent airplane trip mostly because it seemed like too much trouble to bring along. Probably could pack a lot of additional shoes & clothes around the clubs to keep them padded and also save on packing space. I think it would pass the size test for airline checked luggage. Also would be fine to transport clubs safely on a car road trip.
customer_reviews.author: Jfm

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Did the first trip with this bag and had no issues.Held up well. I used a "backbone" device inside the bag and also some cardboard panels around the club heads for added stiffness. I have graphite shafted clubs and irons. I wanted extra protection. I had 14 clubs, pair of shoes, many balls and still carried some of my playing partners gear because his "hard case" weighed too much over the airline limit. Next year he is on his own, I will take more gear!!
customer_reviews.author: K. voegele

customer_reviews.title: The bag is sturdy, well padded and has plenty of room to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this travel bag for a few months now and have taken it on three different trips without a problem. The bag is sturdy, well padded and has plenty of room to hold all your golf items, shoes, extra balls and so on.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great travel bag for the money. I picked this up for a last minute golf trip. The quality is very good and everything seems durable. After one trip, it still looks brand new and I had no damage to my clubs. The only think I did to ensure added protection is fabricate a club head protector. The bag is soft so without some hard protection inside the bag, your club heads could easily be crushed during travel. Also, label your bag! I saw two people in the airport with the exact same bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bag for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Went on a four flight trip and the two bags held up good with minor scuffs from baggage handlers. Item was as described.
customer_reviews.author: Del H.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, good warranty, good company to buy from.
customer_reviews.text: This bag works great for travel, and folds up nicely for storage in the hotel room or at home. I had a warranty claim because the airline mishandled the bag. Caddydaddy replaced the bag immediately. Good folks to buy from!
customer_reviews.author: Hard2please

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and dependable.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bag twice in the last month with no issues. I used the Bag Boy backbone stick in conjunction with this bag for ultimate protection and my clubs arrived unharmed to and from Houston as well as to and from Fort Myers. Works as advertised, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: ffinch66

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bag
customer_reviews.text: I had a travel bag before that gave out after 6 trips. I was hesitant at first about this bag, but after 6 trips, it looks like brand new. No scuff marks or tears. Lightweight, durable, extra padding for the club heads. Everything you want in a golf travel bag. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: MALKY6:1

customer_reviews.title: plenty of room for your clubs, shoes, extra ...
customer_reviews.text: plenty of room for your clubs , shoes, extra shirts. be aware, the airlines will ask you to sign a waiver for damage to your clubs because this is a soft sided case. If you buy a hard case, they will not ask you to waiver.
customer_reviews.author: tom higgins

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to work great - got my clubs to Hawaii and New Zealand ...
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work great - got my clubs to Hawaii and New Zealand safe and sound. Quite a lot of room for clubs and accessories. However, the bag does not like to stand upright on its own once packed.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Frank

customer_reviews.title: Beware of 30 day return deadline if traveling
customer_reviews.text: I used it on a first trip and one of the plastic buckets used to compress the bag broke during travel. When I came back from abroad and wanted to return it, I was told I was out of return period by one day. Was I supposed to change my trip dates so that I would be back before the 30 day period? This is a ridiculous policy!
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy bag. It is a great size for your clubs and stuffing in a few extra items. The only negative is that it a little short. I would buy one from the same company, but slightly longer. M\I bought this for my wife and I have to take her driver out of the golf bag and lay it next to the bag. It still fits in the carrier, but it is less protected being out of the golf bag. A longer men's driver would be more difficult. It rolls well and is well balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Only took on 4 flights but it came out unscathed. Nice product easy to store when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product. A little difficult to keep standing upright
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. A little difficult to keep standing upright, but it works. Combined with the Backbone to keep the top from getting smashed, kept clubs safe with plenty of room. I hit about 70% of my fairways on my trip so I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful.. Great padding around the club area
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful.. Great padding around the club area. didn't even have to sign a waiver at the airport. You can fit your clubs, your shoes and about a weeks worth of clothes in this , if you don't exceed the weight limit. Mine went from the southe to the north with 3 changes of flights and no problems
customer_reviews.author: Sally S

customer_reviews.text: Said you can add padding. No instructions. The fabric seems thin for being 1800. Seems the same as 600..? Haven’t used it yet but should be fine
customer_reviews.author: Dave Siegel

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Quality, Reliable
customer_reviews.text: My friend had this bag and I borrowed it on multiple occasions. So impressed, I decided to quit being a mooch and buy my own. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick D

customer_reviews.title: Highly recomended
customer_reviews.text: Survived first flight with flying colors. Clubs were well protected, this is a great product. Very lightweight and easy to keep under 50 lbs loaded.
customer_reviews.author: charles williams

customer_reviews.title: Durable, strong, rolls well AND half the price of a hardbag.
customer_reviews.text: More than happy with the CaddyDaddy. Had been thinking about getting a hard case but needed something for a quick trip and product got great reviews. Glad I didn't spend the extra money on a hard case. Combined this with a Bag Boy Backbone and feel it's better than the hard case plus lighter and over half the price. Wheels are solid and rolls easy. Good balance so doesn't want to fall over on you when moving through airport or going to rental car. Also very impressed with the material. Honestly thought for the price this would be a single year product but can see this lasting many years.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Hood

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it is a great bag. The inside straps kept the clubs in ...
customer_reviews.text: Was very please with this bag until our return trip from vacation. The stitching on the outside pocket came out and therefore we lost one of our pair of golf shoes. Other than that it is a great bag. The inside straps kept the clubs in securely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price for good quality bag
customer_reviews.text: Travelled to a couple different islands in Hawaii and this bag was great. It held up to air travel and had lots of extra space for golf clothes, golf shoes, etc. My boyfriend has a much more expensive bag and this one held up just as well. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: W. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son and he absolutely loves it. It rolls great and kept his golf clubs protected. After his two trips, it is still in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: D Allen

customer_reviews.title: Durability & Protection
customer_reviews.text: Just went on a trip to Cabo to test out this bag. On arrival bag shows no signs of wear and north pole is a must have item to help protect the driver, woods, etc. Pockets held 2 pairs of shoes easily and another pair inside main bag. Overall bag is in excellent condition on round trip and provided full protection of my Callaway Big Berthas. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: It held up on or first trip.
customer_reviews.text: It protected my clubs and shoes on our first golf trip, we will see how long it holds up but work great first time using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great soft golf travel bag
customer_reviews.text: Nothing not to like. Solid construction, very well made. Best soft travel bag for the money. Purchased the extendable protector as baggage handlers can be a bit rough on golf bags. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E.Welch

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I have had a hard case in the past and it was heavy and took up a LOT of space. This unit is perfect. Good padding and light weight. I've used it twice and have had no issues what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Eckstrom

customer_reviews.title: Not so Durable
customer_reviews.text: The bag was nice and it accommodate everything and is very roomy. So plus on that. However, the bag couldn't even survive 1 trip. I used it to bring my golf clubs once and the bag ripped. Please fix the durability of the bag. Otherwise it's a great product but it just failed when I needed it the most.
customer_reviews.author: Sahil Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Great materials.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and durable materials. Just flew it to Maui, and it still looks like it has never been used.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Whetstone

customer_reviews.title: and was very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Used it on my first trip, made a cross country trip from New Mexico to Hilton Head, SC. The bag was very spacious, protected the club heads well with its padding, and was very easy to use. Zippers worked well, straps and clips worked very well to secure the bag. It was easy to pull along behind me. Doesn't really stand on end very well. Overall, I was delighted with its performance and great looks. The large side pocket was great for my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Weidemann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent support after the sale from Caddy Daddy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent support after the sale from Caddy Daddy! My bag was damaged on a flight by the baggage handlers shortly after receiving it. I contacted Rod at the manufacturer and he responded quickly with an eager to help message. After providing an explanation and some pictures of the damage, Rod quickly provided full warranty coverage! I could not be happier with their support.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: but for us worked excellent. So
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I used this to travel with our kendo gear in it. It fitted two adult bogus, eight shinai and many others nicknacks. I don't know about golf, but for us worked excellent. So... there's another use for the maker to consider, hahaha. Fine piece of travel equipment. We adore it.
customer_reviews.author: Catfan

customer_reviews.title: Quality Case!
customer_reviews.text: After one use, I am impressed with this cover. Clubs made it round trip on airline safely. Paired with CaddyDaddy North Pole and wrapped club heads with extra towels. (Don't know if I really needed to do this, but better safe then sorry). Heavy duty cover that should last for a number of trips. Also fits in rental car better once at destination better then my hard case.
customer_reviews.author: Tom G.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price, heavy duty materials and sturdy zippers. Comes with three bag tags and all you need is a lock to seal the bag up properly.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: It is a very well made travel case for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have used the TCaddyDaddy twice now for golf trips. The travel case is well made and easily holds my large bag, golf shoes, and all my golf gear. I weighed the bag with my clubs and shoes in it and it came in at 40lbs, well under the 50 pound airline limit. I also bought it with the Backbone accessory and highly recommend that you get that with the CaddyDaddy. It protects the clubs in the soft case. It makes the case an even better protector of your clubs.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag & as a recommendation i would buy this bag.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag 4+ months and had it across the Atlantic 5 times already (NYC -> Ireland) - it's big, it's light, it's durable - I know there are some negative reviews here but to date I would have nothing negative to say about this product. Great value, great product - I absolutely love it. Airline depending (I fly Delta), they fly if for free :)
customer_reviews.author: david harrison

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding bag
customer_reviews.text: Amazing golf bag. Used it on cross country trip...no issuses
customer_reviews.author: Ahave E. Brown Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Just received the bag, great value. Description is very accurate and its as good as bags at twice the cost. No better option that I know of for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Angela S

customer_reviews.title: This was great quality but my bag was too small for it ...
customer_reviews.text: This was great quality but my bag was too small for it to fit snugly. I was worried about it traveling on the plane. Returned but they were super easy to work with. Wish it had worked because it was a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Mc In Texas

customer_reviews.title: easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: I bought this travel bag for my boyfriend who travels with his golf clubs at least once a month. So far it has held up very well, no damage to clubs, easy to carry, and even has additional room to pack other items on the sides. I researched a few different bags on Amazon before I made my purchase and I am very pleased that I chose this particular bag. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dena Towning

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for tradeshow booth pull ups
customer_reviews.text: love this, it's huge and great for tradeshow booth items, and has a pad on bottom with wheels so you can drag it if you need. Flys for free with Southwest two bag policy!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Halverson

customer_reviews.title: great golf travel bag.
customer_reviews.text: this is a wonderfully heavy duty golf bag. Very large and well built. has an internal strap as well as two large outer straps to prevent the bag from bursting open when thrown by a goon in the belly of the plane to the tarmac. Well padded with external pockets that hold many items. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: G. Claridge

customer_reviews.title: Good rollin' through the airport
customer_reviews.text: Easy to muscle through the air port, really protects the clubs, I can get a set and a half in plus other goodies. Rolls well. I highly recommend you get the extendable in bag pole with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer Gar

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and efficient golf travel bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag works well for traveling with golf clubs. It fits a bag and clubs nicely with room for excess golf balls, etc.
customer_reviews.author: seamama

customer_reviews.title: I do wish that it was a little more sturdy and would always stand up when put upright
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bag on 5 trips now - so 10 total flights including the return flights. Never a dent on my clubs. I do wish that it was a little more sturdy and would always stand up when put upright. I'm able to pack all my clothes and golf gear into the bag for each trip since its not a hard case. Its been awesome not having to take a carry on, versus having a group D or E boarding group then only to find no room for my damn carry on cause no one wants to pay luggage fees! Often the "oversize" bags are also the first bags out!
customer_reviews.author: kobekatt

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect! Good price
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect! Good price. Clubs made it across the country with no issues. Be sure to check the size of your bag. My Ping Hoofer fit, but I imagine if you have a fatter, cart bag, it may be a challenge to get it inside and zip up.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these golf bags to take on vacation to Mexico. Overall they performed well and saved us money by not having to rent clubs. I only wish they were more stable when standing upright as they have a tendency to fall over. Also, they could use some more rigidity as they kind of sag when you pull them. But as I said, overall they work well.
customer_reviews.author: peter sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Form and Function delivered
customer_reviews.text: Well made, everything advertised to be, held my clubs fine. The airline damaged my suitcase beyond repair, but my clubs were never hurt inside my CaddyDaddy.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase and worth the investment for golf travel
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I have purchased and the bag cover works great. No damages and good padding for the clubs. The wheels hold up and this is a perfect fit for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Viking23

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling with golf clubs.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to bring my golf clubs on cross country flights. Very tough material and had plenty of space. Side pockets easily held my golf shoes. I would recommend the golf extender/umbrella to protect the club heads.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin E. Taylor Jr.

customer_reviews.title: awesome bag
customer_reviews.text: Just traveled with bag very durable lots of room ended up buying one for wife
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Constructed.
customer_reviews.text: This travel bag appears to be well constructed. We have used it twice now and the airlines have failed to damage it! We picked up 4' x 3/4" dowels and strapped it to the driver to provide extra protection. Slice a tennis ball open to put on top of the dowel to protect the travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bag on two trips now, one down to Florida, and one overseas with multiple transfers. I haven't noticed any wear and tear yet and paired with a backbone brace it has done a great job protecting my clubs. No complaints with this purchase and I'd highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Preble

customer_reviews.title: Big and Roomy!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice, sturdy bag. It's pretty big and I would have to think it will fit any size club bag (within reason of course). It has 2 large side pockets - I was able to put my shoes into one of them. Make sure to get a "backbone", if you don't have one you risk the club getting broken when flying/traveling.
customer_reviews.author: CharChar19

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bag for your clubs
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room for your clubs. Lots of pockets nice padding. Took it to Arizona, not one problem. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Twilitegolf

product_meta.title: CaddyDaddy Golf Constrictor 2 Travel Cover
feature_bullets: 1 Year Full Bag Replacement Warranty – covers any damage to the bag caused by airlines
In-Line Skate Wheels & Lockable Zippers (with optional TSA lock not included)
Internal & External Compression Straps to Keep Clubs Secure. Top of the Line 1800D Fabric Construction (3 x the Thickness of 600D Fabric)
Heavily Padded on Top to Protect Club Heads
Lockable Zippers 13 x 50 x 15 inches ; 9 pounds

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
